entry.title: Imprinting of serum neutralizing antibodies by Wuhan-1 mRNA vaccines
entry.content:
Imprinting of serum neutralizing antibodies by Wuhan-1 mRNA vaccines

  • Chieh-Yu Liang
  • Saravanan Raju
  • Michael S. Diamond
Article15 May 2024

entry.title: Evolution of a novel adrenal cell type that promotes parental care
entry.content:
Evolution of a novel adrenal cell type that promotes parental care

The adrenal gland of the oldfield mouse (Peromyscus polionotus) has a recently evolved cell type that promotes monogamous-typical parenting behaviour and is not present in closely related species.

  • Natalie Niepoth
  • Jennifer R. Merritt
  • Andres Bendesky
Article15 May 2024

entry.title: Suppressed thermal transport in silicon nanoribbons by inhomogeneous strain
entry.content:
Suppressed thermal transport in silicon nanoribbons by inhomogeneous strain

We report on a method for inducing uncontaminated and precise inhomogeneous strain in nanoscale silicon ribbons and its use for determining physical effects in these strained materials, in particular, an increase in the range and control of thermal conductivity.

  • Lin Yang
  • Shengying Yue
  • Peng Gao
Article15 May 2024

entry.title: The rise of baobab trees in Madagascar
entry.content:
The rise of baobab trees in Madagascar

We carried out genomic and ecological analyses of all eight extant baobab species, providing insights into their evolutionary history and recommendations for conservation efforts.

  • Jun-Nan Wan
  • Sheng-Wei Wang
  • Qing-Feng Wang
ArticleOpen Access15 May 2024

entry.title: Arresting failure propagation in buildings through collapse isolation
entry.content:
Arresting failure propagation in buildings through collapse isolation

A design approach arrests collapse propagation in buildings after major initial failures by ensuring that specific elements fail before the failure of the most important components for global stability.

  • Nirvan Makoond
  • Andri Setiawan
  • Jose M. Adam
ArticleOpen Access15 May 2024

entry.title: Dispersion-assisted high-dimensional photodetector
entry.content:
Dispersion-assisted high-dimensional photodetector

By combining spatial and frequency dispersive thin-film interfaces with deep residual learning, a miniature photodetector allowing the acquisition of high-dimensional information on light in a single-shot fashion is described.

  • Yandong Fan
  • Weian Huang
  • Wei Li
Article15 May 2024

entry.title: GLP-1-directed NMDA receptor antagonism for obesity treatment
entry.content:
GLP-1-directed NMDA receptor antagonism for obesity treatment

Unimolecular integration of NMDA receptor antagonism with GLP-1 receptor agonism effectively reverses obesity, hyperglycaemia and dyslipidaemia in rodent models of metabolic disease.

  • Jonas Petersen
  • Mette Q. Ludwig
  • Christoffer Clemmensen
ArticleOpen Access15 May 2024

entry.title: Photocatalytic doping of organic semiconductors
entry.content:
Photocatalytic doping of organic semiconductors

A previously undescribed photocatalytic approach enables the effective p-type and n-type doping of organic semiconductors at room temperature using only widely available weak dopants such as oxygen and triethylamine.

  • Wenlong Jin
  • Chi-Yuan Yang
  • Simone Fabiano
ArticleOpen Access15 May 2024

entry.title: The temperature sensor TWA1 is required for thermotolerance in Arabidopsis
entry.content:
The temperature sensor TWA1 is required for thermotolerance in Arabidopsis

TWA1 is a temperature-sensing transcriptional co-regulator that is needed for basal and acquired thermotolerance in Arabidopsis thaliana.

  • Lisa Bohn
  • Jin Huang
  • Erwin Grill
ArticleOpen Access15 May 2024

entry.title: Temporal multiplexing of perception and memory codes in IT cortex
entry.content:
Temporal multiplexing of perception and memory codes in IT cortex

We examined how familiar faces are encoded in inferotemporal, perirhinal and temporal pole face patches, and found that relative response magnitude to familiar versus unfamiliar faces was not a stable indicator of familiarity in any patch.

  • Liang She
  • Marcus K. Benna
  • Doris Y. Tsao
ArticleOpen Access15 May 2024

entry.title: Superconducting diode effect and interference patterns in kagome CsV3Sb5
entry.content:
Superconducting diode effect and interference patterns in kagome CsV3Sb5

We observe the superconducting diode effect and interference patterns in CsV3Sb5, implying a time-reversal symmetry-breaking superconducting order in kagome superconductors.

  • Tian Le
  • Zhiming Pan
  • Xiao Lin
Article15 May 2024

entry.title: Physiological temperature drives TRPM4 ligand recognition and gating
entry.content:
Physiological temperature drives TRPM4 ligand recognition and gating

A temperature-dependent Ca2+-binding site in the intracellular domain of TRPM4 is essential for TRPM4 function in physiological contexts.

  • Jinhong Hu
  • Sung Jin Park
  • Wei Lü
ArticleOpen Access15 May 2024

entry.title: Entanglement of nanophotonic quantum memory nodes in a telecom network
entry.content:
Entanglement of nanophotonic quantum memory nodes in a telecom network

Entanglement of two nanophotonic quantum network nodes is demonstrated through 40  km spools of low-loss fibre and a 35-km long fibre loop deployed in the Boston area urban environment.

  • C. M. Knaut
  • A. Suleymanzade
  • M. D. Lukin
ArticleOpen Access15 May 2024

entry.title: Engineered CD47 protects T cells for enhanced antitumour immunity
entry.content:
Engineered CD47 protects T cells for enhanced antitumour immunity

Combination of TCR or CAR T cells expressing the engineered CD47 variant 47E with anti-CD47 antibody therapy results in synergistic antitumour efficacy due to T cell resistance to clearance by macrophages, while maintaining macrophage recruitment into the tumour microenvironment.

  • Sean A. Yamada-Hunter
  • Johanna Theruvath
  • Crystal L. Mackall
ArticleOpen Access15 May 2024

entry.title: Wavefunction matching for solving quantum many-body problems
entry.content:
Wavefunction matching for solving quantum many-body problems

An approach called wavefunction matching transforms particle interactions so that their wavefunctions match those of easily computable interactions, to allow for calculations of quantum many-body systems that would otherwise be difficult or impossible.

  • Serdar Elhatisari
  • Lukas Bovermann
  • Gianluca Stellin
ArticleOpen Access15 May 2024

entry.title: One-third of Southern Ocean productivity is supported by dust deposition
entry.content:
One-third of Southern Ocean productivity is supported by dust deposition

Nitrate observations over 11 years from autonomous biogeochemical ocean profiling combined with a Southern Hemisphere dust simulation find that iron supplied by dust supports about 30% of Southern Ocean productivity.

  • Jakob Weis
  • Zanna Chase
  • Sonya L. Fiddes
Article15 May 2024

entry.title: A renewably sourced, circular photopolymer resin for additive manufacturing
entry.content:
A renewably sourced, circular photopolymer resin for additive manufacturing

A photopolymer platform derived from renewable lipoates can be 3D-printed into high-resolution parts, which possess properties comparable to some commercial acrylic resins, and then recycled to produce a re-printable resin.

  • Thiago O. Machado
  • Connor J. Stubbs
  • Andrew P. Dove
ArticleOpen Access15 May 2024

entry.title: Volatile working memory representations crystallize with practice
entry.content:
Volatile working memory representations crystallize with practice

Delay- and choice-related activities that are essential for working-memory performance drift during learning and stabilize only after several days of expert performance.

  • Arash Bellafard
  • Ghazal Namvar
  • Peyman Golshani
ArticleOpen Access15 May 2024

entry.title: Release of a ubiquitin brake activates OsCERK1-triggered immunity in rice
entry.content:
Release of a ubiquitin brake activates OsCERK1-triggered immunity in rice

The ubiquitin E3 ligase OsCIE1 acts as a brake to inhibit OsCERK1 during homeostasis; this brake is released after chitin stimulation.

  • Gang Wang
  • Xi Chen
  • Ertao Wang
Article15 May 2024

entry.title: Dimerization and antidepressant recognition at noradrenaline transporter
entry.content:
Dimerization and antidepressant recognition at noradrenaline transporter

Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the noradrenaline transporter in the apo state, bound to noradrenaline and bound to various antidepressants shed light on the substrate transport, molecular recognition and dimeric architecture of this protein.

  • Heng Zhang
  • Yu-Ling Yin
  • Yi Jiang
Article15 May 2024
